bibl.title: Letter from John W. Hart to Philip Showalter Hench, December 15, 1942

div1.p: Hart describes his trip to Cuba and Mexico and his meeting with Moran.

div1.head: Letter from John W. Hart to Philip Showalter Hench, December 15, 1942
div1.opener:
WINTHROP PRODUCTS INC.
Pharmaceuticals Developed by Science and Dedicated to the Physician
350 HUDSON STREET
WINTHROP
N
W
E
S
NEW YORK, NEW YORK
December 15, 1942
Dr. Philip Hench,
The Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench -
div1.p:
I wrote you from Cuba in care of the Surgeon
General, U. S. Army as I did not know just where you would be
located. I assume from my failure to receive a reply that the
letter has gone astray. However, I had quite a nice talk with
Mr. Moran in Cuba and, in his company, visited the correct site.

Enclosed find photographs taken during my
visit and, if you should care for additional copies or, the
film, please let me know.

Things are going along here at the usual
booming rate and I am as, as you might gather, quite busy following
my return from Cuba and Mexico. I hope that the Army is benefitting
from your presence and that the tone in the Medical Department has
been as greatly increased as we would expect.

Again thanking you for your many kindnesses
and with kind personal regards to yourself and Mrs. Hench and
wishing you both a very Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year,
div1.closer:
Yours as ever, John W Hart jwh-jn
enc.
P. O. BOX 90 CANAL STREET STATION
